page.title: 05BO'NESS INDUSTRY - ENERGY
page.content: People who live in this area are dependant on energy for a livlihood as many are employed by British Petroleum in the oil industry at Grangemouth. Coal mining was another source of employment as Bo'ness was a coal mining town. There are no coal mines in Bo'ness now. Kinneil Pit to the west of this area (GR 9881) closed down in 1983. There used to be lots of mines in Bo'ness. St.Mary's School is built of light weight material because there is a mine shaft underneath it. One house in Grangepans had to be demolished because it subsided due to being built on top of a mine.
